title: Album Page, "Sketches of Boat, Fountain, and Building Façade", August 20–21, 1887
medium: Graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric
inscribed:
Recto, in graphite, from top left:
stern / Katwijk / Aug 20, 1887; at right: . . . at / Leiden; at center: side view of fountain  in Leiden / other side just the same. / Dolphins spout from nose / and mouth. / The center panel front view / is an imitation of stalactites / Two cupid dolphins support / the basin which is not a / shell but is formed by the prows of boats/ at bottom center: Fountain at / Leiden / Aug 21st 1887; at lower left: [arrow pointed upward] for dogs.
description: Vertical sheet with multiple sketches.  At top left, a wood-hulled sailboat is seen in shallow water, viewed from stern.  At lower left a running fountain is seen from the left.  The fountain consists of a central pedestal which is decorated on the visible side by a dolphin with prominent scales spouting water from its nose and mouth, while its tail is raised vertically to support a smaller bowl above which fills with water from the spout above and dribbles over the rim into the large basin below.  The basin has a small, bowl-like projection at the corner, possibly providing water for animals.  The final sketch at right is the façade of a late Renaissance building with only its left side visible.  The façade consists of a large arched central pediment thrust up in the center and supported by a continuous engaged column.  A pendentive-like element sweeps down from the pediment to unite with the lower wing of the façade which is topped by a ball finial.  At bottom right, Roman numerals have been sketched: C D D C L X X I X, which are present on a date plaque on the building's façade.

tombstone.epitaph:
Album Page, "Sketches of Boat, Fountain, and Building Façade", August 20–21, 1887.
August 20–21, 1887. Graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-99.
